There's this notion that "Luna would've failed anyway, if Alameda/FTX + affiliated parties used their clients' assets and positions to orchestrate an elaborate attack on it then who cares" in some pockets

This actually gets to a basic white hat vs black hat argument

Genesis, a lending firm, “bought” $1b of UST from LFG in April. This UST was sold into the Curve pool during the early morning hours on Sunday (May 8th), initiating the depeg 

The answer to who attacked UST will be found on the Genesis lending book 

https://t.co/eER09dpzhK

Idea: Dev mining via "Free Market Matching"

The most valuable resource any L1 has is the amount of talent dedicated to building in its ecosystem

Every L1 wants to incentivise builders to its ecosystem. However, there isn't currently an automated, decentralised way to do this

“A Stick is Vulnerable, A Bundle is Unbreakable!”

New PoS Blockchains have a low starting market cap & face a higher risk of getting compromised by a bad actor.

A serious security threat.

Is there a way to improve security for the smaller chains?

Absolutely!
